overview: From 2025-10-18 to 2025-10-19, Sendo-labs/reusable-workflows had 1 new PRs (0 merged), 0 new issues, and 2 active contributors.

topPRs.title: feat(workflows): setup wanted workflow and release management.
topPRs.author: M4XGO
topPRs.body:
## Why
This PR addresses [this issue](https://github.com/Sendo-labs/demo-repository/issues/25).
@standujar requested reusable workflow management. I’ve set up two different workflows: releasing for general projects and npm-publish specifically for plugins.
Additionally, I’ve added a CONTRIBUTING.md to guide contributors on how to contribute to this public repository.

## How
- Added reusable workflows in .github/workflows/.
- Created a release workflow to manage different workflow versions.
- Added documentation in each workflow folder, explaining the purpose of each reusable workflow and how to use it.
- Included a minimal configuration for release-please.

topContributors.summary: Neysixx: Focused on a significant refactor of the Sendo-labs/frontend project, successfully merging PR #1 which involved substantial changes across 370 files (+17867/-16129 lines) to restructure the project and update configurations, demonstrating a primary focus on refactor and feature work.

M4XGO: Significantly contributed to workflow and release management by merging a substantial PR in Sendo-labs/reusable-workflows#1 (+1005/-38 lines), demonstrating a focus on documentation and configuration.

xdrkush: Focused on foundational work, successfully merging a substantial initial commit to Sendo-labs/sendo-api#1, which introduced over 21,000 lines of code. Their contributions primarily involved code and configuration changes, indicating a focus on setting up core functionalities.
